poem:
In Brandenburg, shadows grow  
beneath a sun barely awake—  
divided hearts, the banners  
wave. Along the river, whispers  
hold their breath, guessing  
which way the current tilts  
toward a morning  
still unborn, the plain  
and parted field, dignity  
fragile as the frost  
that promises return.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Far-right AfD eyes further electoral gains in key German state of Brandenburg The far-right Alternative für Deutschland party is hoping to come top in an election in the German state of Brandenburg on Sunday, three weeks after making historic gains in two other regions. The AfD, which has been classified as rightwing extremist in several states by domestic intelligence agencies, is running almost neck and neck with Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s Social Democrats (SPD) in the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
